_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto. Shutoff at 85%, min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure & liquid indicators

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
AMID NLR LLC
North Little Rock Terminal

RMP Executive Summary

AMID NLR LLC (AMID) North Little Rock Terminal in North Little Rock, Arkansas is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen to the community and environment.  AMID believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success.  In fulfilling this commitment, AMID will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices.  All AMID NLR LLC North Little Rock Terminal employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage and security losses.

The North Little Rock Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as health and safety of the employees, contractors and community in which we operate.  We promote health safety and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention, and planning.  This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that the North Little Rock Terminal has designed and implemented.

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

AMID NLR LLC North Little Rock Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of North Little Rock, Arkansas.  The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low sulfur diesel, ethanol, and additives.  The North Little Rock Terminal Complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process (Butane Blending) which encompasses Butane unloading, a Butane storage vessel, pump, and associated piping.  Butane is stored in one vessel and transferred to/blended with gasoline (pipeline injection) through

the use of a fixed piping system and blending skid.

General Accidental Release Prevention Programs:

The Terminal's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by our regulated substances to the employees, public, and the environment.  The covered process, is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 19110.119.  The following accident prevention programs are in place at the North Little Rock Terminal:
1)	Employee Participation
2)	Process Safety Information
3)	Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
4)	Standard Operating Procedures
5)	Operator Training
6)	Contractors
7)	Pre-startup Safety Review
8)	Mechanical Integrity
9)	Work Authorization
10)	Management of Change
11)	Incident Investigation
12)	Emergency Procedures
13)	Compliance Audits
14)	Trade Secrets

Five Year Accident History:

As this is a new process/stationary system, there have been no accidents within the past five (5) years.

Emergency Response Program:

Our Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  Contained with the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions (including alerting and evacuation procedures) to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility.  These emergencies may include airborne releases of chemical substances (inclusive of Butane), spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, or personnel medical emergencies.

Emergency procedures including actions involving the on-site Butane have been coordinated with the North Little Rock Fire Department.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

AMID is continually striving to make the North Little Rock Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for our employees, our neighbors, and our community.  The Facility's focus

is safe, reliable and environmentally sound operations.  The goal of the North Little Rock Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in our health, environmental and safety performance.  In addition, we will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety, and security of the North Little Rock Terminal and surrounding community.

In the case of the Butane Blending Process, an initial Process Hazard Analysis was completed which resulted in actions to eliminate or mitigate identified hazards.  In addition to the initial training provided to the North Little Rock Fire Department, the Terminal will ensure annual training/exercises involving the Process are performed and evaluated to maximize emergency response efforts.
